title: Ernest Allen (American football)
text:
Ernest Allen (born March 11, 1973) signed as a Free agent in 1995 to the <a href="NFL">NFL</a> <a href="Seattle%20Seahawks">Seattle Seahawks</a> as a defensive tackle, then signing with the <a href="NFL%20Europe">NFL Europe</a>'s <a href="Rhein%20Fire">Rhein Fire</a> in 1996 to the same position. Then was signed to the <a href="Arena%20Football%20League">Arena Football League</a> <a href="offensive%20lineman">offensive lineman</a>/<a href="defensive%20lineman">defensive lineman</a>. He has previously played for the <a href="Florida%20Bobcats">Florida Bobcats</a> (1996), the <a href="Albany%20Firebirds">Albany Firebirds</a> (1997), the <a href="Milwaukee%20Mustangs%20%281994-2001%29">Milwaukee Mustangs</a> (1998-1999), the <a href="Orlando%20Predators">Orlando Predators</a> (2000-2003), the <a href="Dallas%20Desperados">Dallas Desperados</a> (2004-2005) and the <a href="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a> Soul (2006), completing his career with the <a href="Georgia%20Force">Georgia Force</a> (2007-2008). Ranks second in league history in tackles for loss and one of the top 10 players in league history in sacks, also being selected to five <a href="All-Arena">All-Arena</a> Teams during his career. He was named Second Team All-Arena in <a href="1998%20All-Arena%20Team">1998</a>, <a href="2001%20All-Arena%20Team">2001</a>, <a href="2002%20All-Arena%20Team">2002</a>, <a href="2003%20All-Arena%20Team">2003</a> and <a href="2006%20All-Arena%20Team">2006</a>.
High school career.
Allen attended <a href="John%20Adams%20High%20School%20%28South%20Bend%2C%20Indiana%29">John Adams High School</a> in <a href="South%20Bend%2C%20Indiana">South Bend, Indiana</a>, and was a <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>. In football, he won first team All-State honors at <a href="defensive%20tackle">defensive tackle</a>, and second team All-League honors at <a href="offensive%20tackle">offensive tackle</a>. In his final two years of high school, he produced 10 <a href="Quarterback%20sack">sacks</a>, 12 forced <a href="fumble">fumble</a>s, 65 <a href="Tackle%20%28football%20move%29">tackles</a>, and six fumble recoveries on <a href="Defense%20%28sport%29">defense</a>.
College career.
Allen attended the <a href="University%20of%20Cincinnati">University of Cincinnati</a>, and finished his stellar <a href="College%20football">college career</a> with 11 sacks and 120 tackles (8 for losses). Six of those sacks, and 45 tackles came during his senior year. Was a Three year starter.
